title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: 224 CASTLE STALKER. Passing the point of Appin, we saw on the leftthe hUls and place of Kingarloch, (Forbes,) uponthe shore of Morven ; and on approaching the pastoral yet uninhabited island of Shuna, observed onour right the demesne of Appin House, the seat ofRobert Downie, Esq. M.P. to whom the Isle ofShuna, and a considerable extent of territory onthe mainland appertains. This enviable residencecommands an extensive view of the verdant islandof Lismore, the rugged coast of Morven, and thelofty mountains of Mull.
